section.title: Inserting code in pom.xml
section.para:
Now click File-New in order to create a osgi.bnd file with the following content:
Bundle-Blueprint-Annotation: true
Because this value is set to true, the blueprint annotation service will attempt to scan the bundle for blueprint annotations.
Export-Package: \ org.panifex.salute.spi;version="1.0"
Enables the classes and interfaces from org.panifex.salute.spi package to become visible to other bundles.
Import-Package: \ org.apache.aries.blueprint.annotation;version="[1.0, 2.0)", \
Defines that our module may use annotations from that package. org.panifex.module.api.content;version="[1.0,2.0)", \
Enables the usage of classes from panifexmodule-api bundle org.panifex.module.api.menu;version="[1.0,2.0)", \ org.zkoss.bind;version="[7.0,8.0)", \ org.zkoss.bind.annotation;version="[7.0,8.0)", \ org.zkoss.mesg;version="[7.0,8.0)", \ org.zkoss.zk.ui;version="[7.0,8.0)", \ org.zkoss.zk.ui.event;version="[7.0,8.0)", \
Enables the usage of classes from panifex-module-api bundle org.zkoss.zul;version="[7.0,8.0)"
Enables the usage of zkoss framework functionalities in our bundle.
Private-Package: org.panifex.salute.spi.
A Private-Package is similar to Export-Package in every way, but it signifies which packages will not be exported by the bundle.
